responses:
theorem Topology.P2_inter_isOpen_left {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] {A B : Set X}
    (hOpenA : IsOpen A) (hP2B : Topology.P2 B) :
    Topology.P2 (A ∩ B) := by
  -- Unfold the definition of `P2`.
  unfold Topology.P2 at *
  -- Take an arbitrary point `x ∈ A ∩ B`.
  intro x hxAB
  -- From `hxAB` we have `x ∈ B`.
  have hxB : x ∈ B := hxAB.2
  -- Apply `P2` for `B` to obtain
  -- `x ∈ interior (closure (interior B))`.
  have hxIntB : x ∈ interior (closure (interior B)) := hP2B hxB
  -- Unpack the membership in the interior: pick an open neighbourhood
  -- `U` of `x` contained in `closure (interior B)`.
  rcases hxIntB with ⟨U, hU_open, hxU, hU_sub⟩
  -- Intersect the neighbourhood with the open set `A`.
  let V : Set X := U ∩ A
  have hV_open : IsOpen V := hU_open.inter hOpenA
  have hxV : x ∈ V := ⟨hxU, hxAB.1⟩
  -- Show that every point of `V` lies in `closure (interior (A ∩ B))`.
  have hV_sub : V ⊆ closure (interior (A ∩ B)) := by
    intro y hyV
    -- Decompose the membership `y ∈ V`.
    have hyU : y ∈ U := (show y ∈ U ∩ A from by
        simpa [V] using hyV).1
    have hyA : y ∈ A := (show y ∈ U ∩ A from by
        simpa [V] using hyV).2
    -- From `U ⊆ closure (interior B)` we get `y ∈ closure (interior B)`.
    have hy_clB : y ∈ closure (interior B) := hU_sub hyU
    -- We show `y ∈ closure (interior (A ∩ B))`
    -- using the neighbourhood characterization of the closure.
    have : y ∈ closure (interior (A ∩ B)) := by
      -- Employ `mem_closure_iff`.
      apply (mem_closure_iff).2
      intro W hW_open hyW
      -- Refine the neighbourhood to stay inside `A`.
      have hWA_open : IsOpen (W ∩ A) := hW_open.inter hOpenA
      have hyWA : y ∈ W ∩ A := ⟨hyW, hyA⟩
      -- Since `y ∈ closure (interior B)`, the refined neighbourhood
      -- meets `interior B`.
      have h_nonempty :
          ((W ∩ A) ∩ interior B).Nonempty :=
        (mem_closure_iff).1 hy_clB (W ∩ A) hWA_open hyWA
      -- Extract a witness `z`.
      rcases h_nonempty with ⟨z, ⟨hzW, hzA⟩, hzIntB⟩
      -- `A ∩ interior B` is open and contained in `A ∩ B`;
      -- hence its points lie in `interior (A ∩ B)`.
      have hzIntAB : z ∈ interior (A ∩ B) := by
        -- `A ∩ interior B` is an open subset of `A ∩ B`.
        have h_open : IsOpen (A ∩ interior B) :=
          hOpenA.inter isOpen_interior
        have h_subset : A ∩ interior B ⊆ A ∩ B := by
          intro t ht; exact ⟨ht.1, interior_subset ht.2⟩
        have hz_mem : z ∈ A ∩ interior B := ⟨hzA, hzIntB⟩
        exact interior_maximal h_subset h_open hz_mem
      -- Therefore, `W` meets `interior (A ∩ B)` at `z`.
      exact ⟨z, ⟨hzW, hzIntAB⟩⟩
    exact this
  -- `V` is an open neighbourhood of `x` contained in the required closure,
  -- so `x` lies in the interior of that closure.
  exact
    (show x ∈ interior (closure (interior (A ∩ B))) from
      ⟨V, hV_open, hxV, hV_sub⟩)

theorem Topology.frontier_interior_subset_closure {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] {A : Set X} :
    frontier (interior A) ⊆ closure A := by
  intro x hx
  -- First, upgrade membership from `frontier (interior A)` to `frontier A`
  have hx_frontierA : x ∈ frontier A :=
    (Topology.frontier_interior_subset_frontier (A := A)) hx
  -- By unfolding `frontier A = closure A \ interior A`, we extract the desired fact
  have : x ∈ closure A ∧ x ∉ interior A := by
    simpa [frontier] using hx_frontierA
  exact this.1

theorem Topology.interior_inter_eq_interiors_of_isOpen
    {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] {A B : Set X}
    (hA : IsOpen A) (hB : IsOpen B) :
    interior (A ∩ B) = interior A ∩ interior B := by
  -- Since `A` and `B` are open, so is `A ∩ B`, and its interior is itself.
  have hInt : interior (A ∩ B) = A ∩ B :=
    (hA.inter hB).interior_eq
  -- The interior of an open set is the set itself.
  have hA_int : interior A = A := hA.interior_eq
  have hB_int : interior B = B := hB.interior_eq
  -- Substitute and simplify.
  simpa [hInt, hA_int, hB_int]
